title.narrative: Fact-finding mission Agro-Energy nexus in Bolivia

description.narrative: The government of the Netherlands has prioritized Climate change as main national policy for development and cooperation, in particular in developing countries. The Ministry of Hydrocarbons and Energy of Bolivia (MHE) https://www.mhe.gob.bo/ is planning to develop a biofuel plant for producing annually 450,000 tons of hydrotreated vegetable oil (HVO).The project addresses the potential agro-energy trade-offs of the a large biodiesel (HVO: Hydrotreated Vegetable Oil) plant that is being planned in Santa Cruz and the options for setting up a sustainable feedstock supply; focusing on the mitigation of negative impacts on the local agri-food producers. Besides, the project identifies opportunities for bilateral collaboration between Bolivia and the Netherlands for a sustainable development of the biofuels program of Bolivia.
Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of people indirectly reached - Total

comment.narrative: A report which presents a clear analysis of the current situation and opportunities.

A factfinding mission report: • An executive summary, • Description of the trade-offs in the agro-energy-climate debate, • Description of the biofuel program and current situation in Bolivia, • A stakeholder mapping, • Opportunities for Dutch organizations and businesses to engage in the biofuel program and other sustainable energy related innovations in Bolivia.
- Participation of WUR in the “Foro BioCombustible” that took place on 3 December 2021 where findings of the mission were presented. https://boliviaemprende.com/noticias/foro-de-biocombustibles-identificara-potencialidadesI
ndirect reached: About 200 persons were present during the Foro Combustible where findings of the mission were presented.

description.narrative: Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of people directly reached - Total

comment.narrative: Factfinding mission report A report which presents a clear analysis of the current situation and opportunities.

A factfinding mission report: • An executive summary, • Description of the trade-offs in the agro-energy-climate debate, • Description of the biofuel program and current situation in Bolivia, • A stakeholder mapping, • Opportunities for Dutch organizations and businesses to engage in the biofuel program and other sustainable energy related innovations in Bolivia.
Direct reached: > 60 persons interviewed before and during mission to gain insight in the biodiesel program and opportunities for sustainable feedstock supply in Bolivia. Local: 25 from private sector, 10 from local knowledge institutes, 15 from the public sector, 10 from NGOs. Dutch: 2
Direct reached according Gender: 50 men; 10 women.
The list with people is in Annex I of the mission report.

title.narrative: Increased impact of an existing PSD project

comment.narrative:
The project fits in the priorities of the Dutch embassy in Lima for Bolivia, Climate adaptation and CSR; which are the central themes of the intervention.
The Netherlands can provide to Bolivia, knowledge transfer, technology an innovative solutions to tackle the challenges to ensure sustainable biofuel production. The project provides relevant information for bilateral relations and economic diplomacy between the Netherlands and Bolivia under the aid and trade policy of the Dutch government, in particular in the Agri& food and energy sectors.
The Dutch embassy is pursuing collaboration with MHE and YPFB on the feasibility of feedstock production in Bolivia (which crop and where it can be best produced). This will involve Dutch knowledge organizations and also private sector partners such as Neste with a stake in HVO production and feedstock supply.
? PSD 7e: Increased impact of an existing PSD project. / other RVO programs…. The project was helpful to strengthen the position of the Netherlands in the field of biofuel production in Bolivia. In doing so, the project complements various EU, BuZa funded and other funded projects that are currently being implemented by WUR in this field.

title.narrative: Number of identified opportunities for investment and/or follow-up PSD projects - Total

comment.narrative: - Elaboration of a one-page recommendations for the Dutch embassy in Lima for engagement with Bolivia on biofuels.

The project identifies concrete opportunities for bilateral cooperation between Bolivia and the Netherlands for the sustainable development of the biofuel chain and for alternative energy solutions involving public and private actors. This includes knowledge, innovation, technology transfer and business opportunities for Dutch private sector. - The one page makes concrete recommendations for the Dutch embassy in Lima for engagement with Bolivia on biofuels. - In addition, a two pager was prepared for MHE with concrete recommendations towards a sustainable feedstock supply. These deliverable provide opportunities for further cooperation between the Dutch embassy in Lima, reposnible for Blolivia, with MHE and YPFB.
The findings of the project were communicated to key local audience in the Biofuel forum that was organized by the Ministry of Hydrocarbons and Energy of Bolivia. The final report and complementary materials were delivered and a final presentation was made for the Dutch embassy in Lima. The embassy, at this stage, decided not to have a broader communication to manage expectations of the Bolivian stakeholders, considering that Peru and Bolivia are no longer eligible for the PSD toolkit program.

title.narrative: Number of members of supported organisations - Total

comment.narrative: A factfinding mission to Bolivia on agro-energy nexus focusing on the HVO biofuel plant in Bolivia.

WUR implemented a field mission to Bolivia in order to gain insight about the feasibility and sustainability of the development of a large biodiesel (HVO: Hydrotreated Vegetable Oil) plant that is being planned by the Ministry of Hydrocarbons and Energy of Bolivia (MHE) in Santa Cruz. The engagement with MHE (Government) and Yacimientos Petrolíferos Fiscales Bolivianos - YPFB (private sector/ semi-Government) in Bolivia has raised awareness and strengthened thinking about sustainable sourcing of feedstock for biofuel production in Bolivia.
Number of members/employees of supported institutions; MHE: 4 men / 1 woman YPFB: 5 men / 1 woman
